welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: [![Discord](https://discordapp.com/api/guilds/222078108977594368/embed.png)](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![David](https://img.shields.io/david/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://david-dm.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js.png?downloads=true&stars=true)](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js/) discord.js is a powerful node.js module that allows you to interact with the [Discord API](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/intro). # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js v9 documentation. The v9 rewrite has taken a lot of time, but it should be much more stable and performant than previous versions. ## Installation **Node.js 6.0.0 or newer is required.** With voice support: `npm install --save discord.js --production` Without voice support: `npm install --save discord.js --production --no-optional` By default, discord.js uses [opusscript](https://www.npmjs.com/package/opusscript) when playing audio over voice connections. If you're looking to play over multiple voice connections, it might be better to install [node-opus](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-opus). discord.js will automatically prefer node-opus over opusscript. ## Guides * [LuckyEvie's general guide](https://eslachance.gitbooks.io/discord-js-bot-guide/content/) * [York's v9 upgrade guide](https://yorkaargh.wordpress.com/2016/09/03/updating-discord-js-bots/) ## Links * [Website](http://hydrabolt.github.io/discord.js/) * [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) * [Discord API Server](https://discord.gg/rV4BwdK) * [Documentation](http://hydrabolt.github.io/discord.js/#!/docs/tag/master) * [Legacy Documentation](http://discordjs.readthedocs.io/en/8.1.0/docs_client.html) * [GitHub](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js) * [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) * [Examples](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js/tree/master/docs/custom/examples) * [Related Libraries](https://discordapi.com/unofficial/libs.html) ## Help If you don't understand something in this documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).

updating.name: Updating your code
updating.content:
# About Version 9
The version 9 (v9) rewrite takes a much more object-oriented approach than previous versions,
which allows your code to be much more readable and manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions. It also has support for newer Discord Features, such as emojis.

## Upgrading your code
Version 9, while containing a sizable number of breaking changes, does not require much change in your code's logic -
most of the concepts are still the same, but loads of functions have been moved around.
The vast majority of methods you're used to using have been moved out of the Client class,
into other more relevant classes where they belong.
Because of this, you will need to convert most of your calls over to the new methods.

Here are a few examples of methods that have changed:
* `Client.sendMessage(channel, message)` ==> `TextChannel.sendMessage(message)`
  * `Client.sendMessage(user, message)` ==> `User.sendMessage(message)`
* `Client.updateMessage(message, "New content")` ==> `Message.edit("New Content")`
* `Client.getChannelLogs(channel, limit)` ==> `TextChannel.fetchMessages({options})`
* `Server.detailsOfUser(User)` ==> `Server.members.get(User).properties` (retrieving a member gives a GuildMember object)
* `Client.joinVoiceChannel(voicechannel)` => `VoiceChannel.join()`

A couple more important details:
* `Client.loginWithToken("token")` ==> `client.login("token")`
* `Client.servers.length` ==> `client.guilds.size` (all instances of `server` are now `guild`)

## Callbacks
Version 9 eschews callbacks in favour of Promises. This means all code relying on callbacks must be changed.  
For example, the following code:

```js
client.getChannelLogs(channel, 100, function(messages) {
  console.log(`${messages.length} messages found`);
});
```

```js
channel.fetchMessages({limit: 100}).then(messages => {
  console.log(`${messages.size} messages found`);
});
```

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The starting point for making a Discord Bot.

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: resolver

props.name: actions

props.name: voice
props.description: The Voice Manager of the Client

props.name: shard
props.description: The shard helpers for the client (only if the process was spawned as a child, such as from a ShardingManager)

props.name: users
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored users

props.name: guilds
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored guilds

props.name: channels
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored channels

props.name: presences
props.description: A Collection of presences for friends of the logged in user.<warn>This is only present for user accounts, not bot accounts!</warn>

props.name: token
props.description: The authorization token for the logged in user/bot.

props.name: email
props.description: The email, if there is one, for the logged in Client

props.name: password
props.description: The password, if there is one, for the logged in Client

props.name: user
props.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

props.name: readyAt
props.description: The date at which the Client was regarded as being in the `READY` state.

props.name: status
props.description: The status for the logged in Client.

props.name: uptime
props.description: The uptime for the logged in Client.

props.name: voiceConnections
props.description: Returns a Collection, mapping Guild ID to Voice Connections.

props.name: emojis
props.description: The emojis that the client can use. Mapped by emoji ID.

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp that the client was last ready at

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it'smuch better to use a bot account rather than a user account.Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User botsthat are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>
examples: // log the client in using a tokenconst token = 'my token';client.login(token);
// log the client in using email and passwordconst email = 'user@email.com';const password = 'supersecret123';client.login(email, password);

params.name: tokenOrEmail
params.description: The token or email used for the account. If it is an email, a password _must_ beprovided.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for the account, only needed if an email was provided.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the client and logs out.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description: This shouldn't really be necessary to most developers as it is automatically invoked every 30 seconds, howeverif you wish to force a sync of Guild data, you can use this. Only applicable to user accounts.

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array or collection of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description: Caches a user, or obtains it from the cache if it's already cached.If the user isn't already cached, it will only be obtainable by OAuth bot accounts.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the user to obtain

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Fetches an invite object from an invite code.

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetch a webhook by ID.

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description: Sweeps all channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.

params.name: lifetime
params.description: Messages that are older than this (in seconds)will be removed from the caches. The default is based on the client's `messageCacheLifetime` option.

returns.description: Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable.

events.name: guildEmojiCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever an emoji is created

events.name: guildEmojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever an emoji is deleted

events.name: guildEmojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever an emoji is updated

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild.

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: messageUpdate

events.name: warn

events.name: debug

events.name: guildCreate

events.name: channelCreate

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is deleted.

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the pins of a Channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event, not much informationcan be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occured in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild is deleted/left.

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of Guild members is received (all members come from the same guild)

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their ID

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member's presence changes, or they change one of their details.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the presence update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the presence update

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large Guild

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user started typing in

events.name: typingStop
events.description: Emitted whenever a user stops typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user stopped typing in

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the voice state update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the voice state update

events.name: disconnect
events.description: Emitted whenever the client websocket is disconnected

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the Client encounters a serious connection error

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the Client becomes ready to start working

events.name: reconnecting
events.description: Emitted when the Client tries to reconnect after being disconnected

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has joined a guild

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild Member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname

events.name: guildMemberSpeaking
events.description: Emitted once a Guild Member starts/stops speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the member is speaking

classes.description: The DataResolver identifies different objects and tries to resolve a specific piece of information from them, e.g.extracting a User from a Message object.

params.name: client
params.description: The client the resolver is for

methods.name: resolveUser
methods.description: Resolves a UserResolvable to a User object

methods.name: resolveUserID
methods.description: Resolves a UserResolvable to a user ID string

methods.name: resolveGuild
methods.description: Resolves a GuildResolvable to a Guild object

methods.name: resolveGuildMember
methods.description: Resolves a GuildMemberResolvable to a GuildMember object

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member is part of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is part of the guild

methods.name: resolveChannel
methods.description: Resolves a ChannelResolvable to a Channel object

methods.name: resolveInviteCode
methods.description: Resolves InviteResolvable to an invite code

methods.name: resolvePermission
methods.description: Resolves a PermissionResolvable to a permission number

methods.name: resolveString

methods.name: resolveBase64
methods.description: Resolves a Base64Resolvable to a Base 64 image

params.name: data
params.description: The base 64 resolvable you want to resolve

methods.name: resolveFile
methods.description: Resolves a FileResolvable to a Buffer

classes.name: ClientManager
classes.description: Manages the State and Background Tasks of the Client

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that instantiated this Manager

props.name: heartbeatInterval
props.description: The heartbeat interval, null if not yet set

methods.name: connectToWebSocket
methods.description: Connects the Client to the WebSocket

params.name: resolve
params.description: Function to run when connection is successful

params.name: reject
params.description: Function to run when connection fails

methods.name: setupKeepAlive
methods.description: Sets up a keep-alive interval to keep the Client's connection valid

params.name: time
params.description: The interval in milliseconds at which heartbeat packets should be sent

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: A base class for different types of rate limiting handlers for the REST API.

props.name: restManager
props.description: The RESTManager that instantiated this RequestHandler

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

methods.name: push
methods.description: Push a new API request into this bucket

params.name: request
params.description: The new request to push into the queue

methods.name: handle
methods.description: Attempts to get this RequestHandler to process its current queue

classes.name: SequentialRequestHandler
classes.description: Handles API Requests sequentially, i.e. we wait until the current request is finished before moving ontothe next. This plays a _lot_ nicer in terms of avoiding 429's when there is more than one session of the account,but it can be slower.

props.name: waiting
props.description: Whether this rate limiter is waiting for a response from a request

props.name: endpoint
props.description: The endpoint that this handler is handling

props.name: timeDifference
props.description: The time difference between Discord's Dates and the local computer's Dates. A positive number means the localcomputer's time is ahead of Discord's.

props.name: restManager
props.description: The RESTManager that instantiated this RequestHandler

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Performs a request then resolves a promise to indicate its readiness for a new request

methods.name: push
methods.description: Push a new API request into this bucket

params.name: request
params.description: The new request to push into the queue

methods.name: handle
methods.description: Attempts to get this RequestHandler to process its current queue

classes.name: ClientVoiceManager
classes.description: Manages all the voice stuff for the Client

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this voice manager

props.name: connections
props.description: A collection mapping connection IDs to the Connection objects

props.name: pending
props.description: Pending connection attempts, maps Guild ID to VoiceChannel

methods.name: sendVoiceStateUpdate
methods.description: Sends a request to the main gateway to join a voice channel

methods.name: joinChannel
methods.description: Sets up a request to join a voice channel

classes.name: PendingVoiceConnection
classes.description: Represents a Pending Voice Connection

props.name: voiceManager
props.description: The ClientVoiceManager that instantiated this pending connection

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that this pending voice connection will attempt to join

props.name: deathTimer
props.description: The timeout that will be invoked after 15 seconds signifying a failure to connect

props.name: data
props.description: An object containing data required to connect to the voice servers with

methods.name: setTokenAndEndpoint
methods.description: Set the token and endpoint required to connect to the the voice servers

methods.name: setSessionID
methods.description: Sets the Session ID for the connection

methods.name: upgrade
methods.description: Upgrades this Pending Connection to a full Voice Connection

classes.name: StreamDispatcher
classes.description: The class that sends voice packet data to the voice connection.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => {  // you can play a file or a stream here:  connection.playFile('./file.mp3').then(dispatcher => {  });});```

props.name: passes
props.description: How many passes the dispatcher should take when sending packets to reduce packet loss. Values over 5aren't recommended, as it means you are using 5x more bandwidth. You _can_ edit this at runtime.

props.name: paused
props.description: Whether playing is paused

props.name: time
props.description: How long the stream dispatcher has been "speaking" for

props.name: totalStreamTime
props.description: The total time, taking into account pauses and skips, that the dispatcher has been streaming for

props.name: volume
props.description: The volume of the stream, relative to the stream's input volume

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume relative to the input stream - i.e. 1 is normal, 0.5 is half, 2 is double.

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume that you want to set

methods.name: setVolumeDecibels
methods.description: Set the volume in decibels

methods.name: setVolumeLogarithmic
methods.description: Set the volume so that a perceived value of 0.5 is half the perceived volume etc.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Stops sending voice packets to the voice connection (stream may still progress however)

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes sending voice packets to the voice connection (may be further on in the stream than when paused)

methods.name: end
methods.description: Stops the current stream permanently and emits an `end` event.

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted when the dispatcher starts/stops speaking

params.name: value
params.description: Whether or not the dispatcher is speaking

events.name: start
events.description: Emitted once the dispatcher starts streaming

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted once the stream has ended. Attach a `once` listener to this.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted once the stream has encountered an error. Attach a `once` listener to this. Also emits `end`.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when the stream wants to give debug information.

classes.name: AudioPlayer
classes.description: Represents the Audio Player of a Voice Connection

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: The voice connection the player belongs to

props.name: dispatcher
props.description: The current stream dispatcher, if a stream is being played

classes.name: VoiceReceiver
classes.description: Receives voice data from a voice connection.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => { const receiver = connection.createReceiver();});```

props.name: destroyed
props.description: Whether or not this receiver has been destroyed.

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: The VoiceConnection that instantiated this

methods.name: recreate
methods.description: If this VoiceReceiver has been destroyed, running `recreate()` will recreate the listener.This avoids you having to create a new receiver.<info>Any streams that you had prior to destroying the receiver will not be recreated.</info>

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroy this VoiceReceiver, also ending any streams that it may be controlling.

methods.name: createOpusStream
methods.description: Creates a readable stream for a user that provides opus data while the user is speaking. When the userstops speaking, the stream is destroyed.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

methods.name: createPCMStream
methods.description: Creates a readable stream for a user that provides PCM data while the user is speaking. When the userstops speaking, the stream is destroyed. The stream is 32-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted whenever a voice packet cannot be decrypted

events.name: opus
events.description: Emitted whenever voice data is received from the voice connection. This is _always_ emitted (unlike PCM).

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

events.name: pcm
events.description: Emits decoded voice data when it's received. For performance reasons, the decoding will onlyhappen if there is at least one `pcm` listener on this receiver.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

classes.name: SecretKey
classes.description: Represents a Secret Key used in encryption over voice

props.name: key
props.description: The key used for encryption

classes.name: VoiceConnection
classes.description: Represents a connection to a Voice Channel in Discord.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => {});```

props.name: voiceManager
props.description: The Voice Manager that instantiated this connection

props.name: channel
props.description: The voice channel this connection is currently serving

props.name: speaking
props.description: Whether we're currently transmitting audio

props.name: receivers
props.description: An array of Voice Receivers that have been created for this connection

props.name: authentication
props.description: The authentication data needed to connect to the voice server

props.name: player
props.description: The audio player for this voice connection

props.name: ssrcMap
props.description: Map SSRC to speaking values

props.name: sockets
props.description: Object that wraps contains the `ws` and `udp` sockets of this voice connection

methods.name: setSpeaking
methods.description: Sets whether the voice connection should display as "speaking" or not

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnect the voice connection, causing a disconnect and closing event to be emitted.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect the voice connection

methods.name: playFile
methods.description: Play the given file in the voice connection.
examples: // play files nativelyvoiceChannel.join() .then(connection => {   const dispatcher = connection.playFile('C:/Users/Discord/Desktop/music.mp3'); }) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: playStream
methods.description: Plays and converts an audio stream in the voice connection.
examples: // play streams using ytdl-coreconst ytdl = require('ytdl-core');const streamOptions = { seek: 0, volume: 1 };voiceChannel.join() .then(connection => {   const stream = ytdl('https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XAWgeLF9EVQ', {filter : 'audioonly'});   const dispatcher = connection.playStream(stream, streamOptions); }) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: playConvertedStream
methods.description: Plays a stream of 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

methods.name: createReceiver
methods.description: Creates a VoiceReceiver so you can start listening to voice data. It's recommended to only create one of these.

events.name: debug
events.description: Debug info from the connection

events.name: warn
events.description: Warning info from the connection

events.name: disconnect
events.description: Emitted when the voice connection disconnects

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the connection encounters an error.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted once the connection is ready, when a promise to join a voice channel resolves,the connection will already be ready.

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts/stops speaking

params.name: user
params.description: The user that has started/stopped speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the user is speaking

classes.name: VoiceWebSocket
classes.description: Represents a Voice Connection's WebSocket

props.description: The Voice Connection that this WebSocket serves

props.name: client

methods.description: Resets the current WebSocket

methods.name: connect

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends data to the WebSocket if it is open.

params.name: data
params.description: the data to send to the WebSocket

methods.name: sendPacket
methods.description: JSON.stringify's a packet and then sends it to the WebSocket Server.

methods.name: onOpen
methods.description: Called whenever the WebSocket opens

methods.name: onMessage
methods.description: Called whenever a message is received from the WebSocket

params.name: event
params.description: the message event that was received

methods.name: onClose
methods.description: Called whenever the connection to the WebSocket Server is lost

methods.name: onError
methods.description: Called whenever an error occurs with the WebSocket.

methods.name: onPacket
methods.description: Called whenever a valid packet is received from the WebSocket

methods.name: setHeartbeat
methods.description: Sets an interval at which to send a heartbeat packet to the WebSocket

params.name: interval
params.description: the interval at which to send a heartbeat packet

methods.name: clearHeartbeat
methods.description: Clears a heartbeat interval, if one exists

methods.name: sendHeartbeat
methods.description: Sends a heartbeat packet

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted once the voice websocket receives the ready packet

events.name: sessionDescription
events.description: Emitted once the Voice Websocket receives a description of this voice session

params.name: encryptionMode
params.description: the type of encryption being used

params.name: secretKey
params.description: the secret key used for encryption

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted whenever a speaking packet is received

events.name: unknownPacket
events.description: Emitted when an unhandled packet is received

props.description: A WebSocket Packet manager, it handles all the messages

props.description: The status of the WebSocketManager, a type of Constants.Status. It defaults to IDLE.

props.description: The session ID of the connection, null if not yet available.

props.description: The packet count of the client, null if not yet available.

props.description: Whether READY was emitted normally (all packets received) or not

props.description: An object with keys that are websocket event names that should be ignored

methods.description: Connects the client to a given gateway

methods.description: Sends a packet to the gateway

params.name: data
params.description: An object that can be JSON stringified

params.description: Whether or not to send the packet immediately

methods.name: eventOpen
methods.description: Run whenever the gateway connections opens up

methods.name: _sendResume
methods.description: Sends a gateway resume packet, in cases of unexpected disconnections.

methods.name: _sendNewIdentify
methods.description: Sends a new identification packet, in cases of new connections or failed reconnections.

methods.name: eventClose
methods.description: Run whenever the connection to the gateway is closed, it will try to reconnect the client.

methods.name: eventMessage
methods.description: Run whenever a message is received from the WebSocket. Returns `true` if the messagewas handled properly.

methods.name: eventError
methods.description: Run whenever an error occurs with the WebSocket connection. Tries to reconnect

methods.name: checkIfReady
methods.description: Runs on new packets before `READY` to see if the Client is ready yet, if it is preparesthe `READY` event.

methods.name: tryReconnect
methods.description: Tries to reconnect the client, changing the status to Constants.Status.RECONNECTING.

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description: This is a utility class that can be used to help you spawn shards of your Client. Each shard is completely separatefrom the other. The Shard Manager takes a path to a file and spawns it under the specified amount of shards safely.If you do not select an amount of shards, the manager will automatically decide the best amount.<warn>The Sharding Manager is still experimental</warn>

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

params.name: options.totalShards
params.description: Number of shards to spawn, or "auto"

params.name: options.respawn
params.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

params.name: options.shardArgs
params.description: Arguments to pass to the shard script when spawning

params.name: options.token
params.description: Token to use for automatic shard count and passing to shards

props.name: file
props.description: Path to the shard script file

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Amount of shards that this manager is going to spawn

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: shardArgs
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to shards.

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

methods.name: createShard
methods.description: Spawns a single shard.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the shard to spawn. **This is usually not necessary.**

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

params.name: delay
params.description: How long to wait in between spawning each shard (in milliseconds)

methods.name: _spawn
methods.description: Actually spawns shards, unlike that poser above >:(

params.name: delay
params.description: How long to wait in between spawning each shard (in milliseconds)

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Send a message to all shards.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be sent to the shards

methods.name: broadcastEval
methods.description: Evaluates a script on all shards, in the context of the Clients.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on each shard

methods.name: fetchClientValues
methods.description: Fetches a Client property value of each shard.
examples: manager.fetchClientValues('guilds.size').then(results => {  console.log(`${results.reduce((prev, val) => prev + val, 0)} total guilds`);}).catch(console.error);

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

params.name: content
params.description: Text message to send with the attachment

methods.description: Send a code block to this channel

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a single message from this channel, regardless of it being cached or not.<warn>Only OAuth bot accounts can use this method.</warn>
examples: // get messagechannel.fetchMessage('99539446449315840')  .then(message => console.log(message.content))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: messageID
params.description: The ID of the message to get

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples: // stop typing in a channelchannel.stopTyping();
// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete given messages.Only OAuth Bot accounts may use this method.

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages to delete, or number of messages to delete

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples: // delete the channelchannel.delete() .then() // success .catch(console.error); // log error

classes.name: Guild
classes.description: Represents a Guild (or a Server) on Discord.<info>It's recommended to see if a guild is available before performing operations or reading data from it. You cancheck this with `guild.available`.</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that created the instance of the the Guild.

props.name: members
props.description: A Collection of members that are in this Guild. The key is the member's ID, the value is the member.

props.name: channels
props.description: A Collection of channels that are in this Guild. The key is the channel's ID, the value is the channel.

props.name: roles
props.description: A Collection of roles that are in this Guild. The key is the role's ID, the value is the role.

props.name: available
props.description: Whether the Guild is available to access. If it is not available, it indicates a server outage.

props.name: id
props.description: The Unique ID of the Guild, useful for comparisons.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the guild

props.name: icon
props.description: The hash of the guild icon, or null if there is no icon.

props.name: splash
props.description: The hash of the guild splash image, or null if no splash (VIP only)

props.name: region
props.description: The region the guild is located in

props.name: memberCount
props.description: The full amount of members in this Guild as of `READY`

props.name: large
props.description: Whether the guild is "large" (has more than 250 members)

props.name: presences
props.description: A collection of presences in this Guild

props.name: features
props.description: An array of guild features.

props.name: emojis
props.description: A Collection of emojis that are in this Guild. The key is the emoji's ID, the value is the emoji.

props.name: afkTimeout
props.description: The time in seconds before a user is counted as "away from keyboard".

props.name: afkChannelID
props.description: The ID of the voice channel where AFK members are moved.

props.name: embedEnabled
props.description: Whether embedded images are enabled on this guild.

props.name: verificationLevel
props.description: The verification level of the guild.

props.name: joinedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the client user joined the guild at

props.name: ownerID
props.description: The user ID of this guild's owner.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the guild was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the guild was created

props.name: joinedAt
props.description: The time the client user joined the guild

props.name: iconURL
props.description: Gets the URL to this guild's icon (if it has one, otherwise it returns null)

props.name: owner
props.description: The owner of the Guild

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: If the client is connected to any voice channel in this guild, this will be the relevant VoiceConnection.

props.name: defaultChannel
props.description: The `#general` GuildChannel of the server.

methods.name: setup
methods.description: Sets up the Guild

params.name: data
params.description: The raw data of the guild

methods.name: member
methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the User is present in the guild.
examples: // get the guild member of a userconst member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of

methods.name: fetchBans
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of banned users in this Guild.

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of invites to this Guild. Resolves with a Collection mapping invites by their codes.

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetch all webhooks for the guild.

methods.name: fetchMember
methods.description: Fetch a single guild member from a user.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to fetch the member for

methods.name: fetchMembers
methods.description: Fetches all the members in the Guild, even if they are offline. If the Guild has less than 250 members,this should not be necessary.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query to provide when fetching members

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.
examples: // set the guild name and regionguild.edit({ name: 'Discord Guild', region: 'london',}).then(updated => console.log(`New guild name ${updated.name} in region ${updated.region}`)).catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild nameguild.setName('Discord Guild') .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild name to ${guild.name}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the Guild

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild regionguild.setRegion('london') .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild region to ${guild.region}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: region
params.description: The new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild verification levelguild.setVerificationLevel(1) .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild verification level to ${guild.verificationLevel}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: verificationLevel
params.description: The new verification level of the guild

methods.name: setAFKChannel
methods.description: Edit the AFK channel of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild AFK channelguild.setAFKChannel(channel) .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild AFK channel to ${guild.afkChannel}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setAFKTimeout
methods.description: Edit the AFK timeout of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild AFK channelguild.setAFKTimeout(60) .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild AFK timeout to ${guild.afkTimeout}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Set a new Guild Icon.
examples: // edit the guild iconguild.setIcon(fs.readFileSync('./icon.png')) .then(updated => console.log('Updated the guild icon')) .catch(console.error);

params.name: icon
params.description: The new icon of the guild

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild ownerguild.setOwner(guilds.members[0]) .then(updated => console.log(`Updated the guild owner to ${updated.owner.username}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: owner
params.description: The new owner of the Guild

methods.name: setSplash
methods.description: Set a new Guild Splash Logo.
examples: // edit the guild splashguild.setIcon(fs.readFileSync('./splash.png')) .then(updated => console.log('Updated the guild splash')) .catch(console.error);

params.name: splash
params.description: The new splash screen of the guild

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.
examples: // ban a userguild.ban('123123123123');

params.name: deleteDays
params.description: The amount of days worth of messages from this user that shouldalso be deleted. Between `0` and `7`.

returns.description: Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannotbe resolved, the user ID will be the result.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the Guild.
examples: // unban a userguild.unban('123123123123') .then(user => console.log(`Unbanned ${user.username} from ${guild.name}`)) .catch(reject);

methods.name: pruneMembers
methods.description: Prunes members from the guild based on how long they have been inactive.
examples: // see how many members will be prunedguild.pruneMembers(12, true)  .then(pruned => console.log(`This will prune ${pruned} people!`);  .catch(console.error);
// actually prune the membersguild.pruneMembers(12)  .then(pruned => console.log(`I just pruned ${pruned} people!`);  .catch(console.error);

params.name: days
params.description: Number of days of inactivity required to kick

params.name: dry
params.description: If true, will return number of users that will be kicked, without actually doing it

returns.description: The number of members that were/will be kicked

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Syncs this guild (already done automatically every 30 seconds). Only applicable to user accounts.

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new Channel in the Guild.
examples: // create a new text channelguild.createChannel('new-general', 'text') .then(channel => console.log(`Created new channel ${channel}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new channel

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, and optionally updates it with the given information.
examples: // create a new roleguild.createRole() .then(role => console.log(`Created role ${role}`)) .catch(console.error);
// create a new role with dataguild.createRole({ name: 'Super Cool People' })  .then(role => console.log(`Created role ${role}`))  .catch(console.error)

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the role with

methods.name: createEmoji
methods.description: Creates a new custom emoji in the guild.
examples: // create a new emoji from a urlguild.createEmoji('https://i.imgur.com/w3duR07.png', 'rip') .then(emoji => console.log(`Created new emoji with name ${emoji.name}!`)) .catch(console.error);
// create a new emoji from a file on your computerguild.createEmoji('./memes/banana.png', 'banana') .then(emoji => console.log(`Created new emoji with name ${emoji.name}!`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: deleteEmoji
methods.description: Delete an emoji.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.
examples: // leave a guildguild.leave() .then(g => console.log(`Left the guild ${g}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.
examples: // delete a guildguild.delete() .then(g => console.log(`Deleted the guild ${g}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setRolePosition
methods.description: Set the position of a role in this guild

params.name: role
params.description: the role to edit, can be a role object or a role ID.

params.name: position
params.description: the new position of the role

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operationsit is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is oftenwhat most users need.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Guild's name instead of the Guild object.
examples: // logs: Hello from My Guild!console.log(`Hello from ${guild}!`);
// logs: Hello from My Guild!console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

classes.name: GuildChannel
classes.description: Represents a Guild Channel (i.e. Text Channels and Voice Channels)

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the channel is in

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the Guild Channel

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the channel in the list.

props.name: permissionOverwrites
props.description: A map of permission overwrites in this channel for roles and users.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel, either:* `dm` - a DM channel* `group` - a Group DM channel* `text` - a guild text channel* `voice` - a guild voice channel

props.name: id
props.description: The unique ID of the channel

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the channel was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the channel was created

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permissionoverwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.
examples: // overwrite permissions for a message authormessage.channel.overwritePermissions(message.author, { SEND_MESSAGES: false}).then(() => console.log('Done!')).catch(console.error);

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: The user or role to update

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel namechannel.setName('not_general') .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new name is ${newChannel.name}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel positionchannel.setPosition(2) .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new position is ${newChannel.position}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting') .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Create an invite to this Guild Channel

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the Channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples: // Outputs: Hello from #generalconsole.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);
// Outputs: Hello from #generalconsole.log('Hello from ' + channel);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples: // delete the channelchannel.delete() .then() // success .catch(console.error); // log error

classes.name: GuildMember
classes.description: Represents a Member of a Guild on Discord

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this GuildMember

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild that this member is part of

props.name: user
props.description: The user that this guild member instance Represents

props.name: serverDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is deafened server-wide

props.name: serverMute
props.description: Whether this member is muted server-wide

props.name: selfMute
props.description: Whether this member is self-muted

props.name: selfDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is self-deafened

props.name: voiceSessionID
props.description: The voice session ID of this member, if any

props.name: voiceChannelID
props.description: The voice channel ID of this member, if any

props.name: speaking
props.description: Whether this member is speaking

props.name: nickname
props.description: The nickname of this Guild Member, if they have one

props.name: joinedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the member joined the guild at

props.name: joinedAt
props.description: The time the member joined the guild

props.name: presence
props.description: The presence of this Guild Member

props.name: roles
props.description: A list of roles that are applied to this GuildMember, mapped by the role ID.

props.name: highestRole
props.description: The role of the member with the highest position.

props.name: mute
props.description: Whether this member is muted in any way

props.name: deaf
props.description: Whether this member is deafened in any way

props.name: voiceChannel
props.description: The voice channel this member is in, if any

props.name: id

props.name: permissions
props.description: The overall set of permissions for the guild member, taking only roles into account

props.name: kickable

props.name: bannable
props.description: Whether the member is bannable by the client user.

methods.name: permissionsIn
methods.description: Returns `channel.permissionsFor(guildMember)`. Returns evaluated permissions for a member in a guild channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: Guild channel to use as context

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks if any of the member's roles have a permission.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the roles to explicitly have the exact permission

methods.name: hasPermissions
methods.description: Checks whether the roles of the member allows them to perform specific actions.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the member to explicitly have the exact permissions

methods.name: missingPermissions
methods.description: Checks whether the roles of the member allows them to perform specific actions, and lists any missing permissions.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the member to explicitly have the exact permissions

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit a Guild Member

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the member with

methods.name: setMute
methods.description: Mute/unmute a user

params.name: mute
params.description: Whether or not the member should be muted

methods.name: setDeaf
methods.description: Deafen/undeafen a user

params.name: deaf
params.description: Whether or not the member should be deafened

methods.name: setVoiceChannel
methods.description: Moves the Guild Member to the given channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to move the member to

methods.name: setRoles
methods.description: Sets the Roles applied to the member.

params.name: roles
params.description: The roles or role IDs to apply

methods.name: addRole
methods.description: Adds a single Role to the member.

params.name: role
params.description: The role or ID of the role to add

methods.name: addRoles
methods.description: Adds multiple roles to the member.

params.name: roles
params.description: The roles or role IDs to add

methods.name: removeRole
methods.description: Removes a single Role from the member.

params.name: role
params.description: The role or ID of the role to remove

methods.name: removeRoles
methods.description: Removes multiple roles from the member.

params.name: roles
params.description: The roles or role IDs to remove

methods.name: setNickname
methods.description: Set the nickname for the Guild Member

params.name: nick
params.description: The nickname for the Guild Member

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes any DMs with this Guild Member

methods.name: kick
methods.description: Kick this member from the Guild

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Ban this Guild Member
examples: // ban a guild memberguildMember.ban(7);

params.name: deleteDays
params.description: The amount of days worth of messages from this member that shouldalso be deleted. Between `0` and `7`.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the Member object.
examples: // logs: Hello from <@123456789>!console.log(`Hello from ${member}!`);

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel
examples: // send a messagechannel.sendMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel
examples: // send a TTS messagechannel.sendTTSMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent tts message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendFile

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

params.name: content
params.description: Text message to send with the attachment

methods.name: sendCode
methods.description: Send a code block to this channel

classes.name: Invite
classes.description: Represents an Invitation to a Guild Channel.<warn>The only guaranteed properties are `code`, `guild` and `channel`. Other properties can be missing.</warn>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the invite

props.name: guild
props.description: The Guild the invite is for. If this Guild is already known, this will be a Guild object. If the Guild isunknown, this will be a Partial Guild.

props.name: code
props.description: The code for this invite

props.name: temporary
props.description: Whether or not this invite is temporary

props.name: maxAge
props.description: The maximum age of the invite, in seconds

props.name: uses
props.description: How many times this invite has been used

props.name: maxUses
props.description: The maximum uses of this invite

props.name: inviter
props.description: The user who created this invite

props.name: channel
props.description: The Channel the invite is for. If this Channel is already known, this will be a GuildChannel object.If the Channel is unknown, this will be a Partial Guild Channel.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the invite was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the invite was created

props.name: expiresTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the invite will expire at

props.name: expiresAt
props.description: The time the invite will expire

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the invite

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this invite

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Invite's URL instead of the object.
examples: // logs: Invite: https://discord.gg/A1b2C3console.log(`Invite: ${invite}`);

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a Message on Discord

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the Message

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the message was sent in

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the message (unique in the channel it was sent)

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the message

props.name: content
props.description: The content of the message

props.name: author
props.description: The author of the message

props.name: member
props.description: Represents the Author of the message as a Guild Member. Only available if the message comes from a Guildwhere the author is still a member.

props.name: pinned
props.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

props.name: nonce
props.description: A random number used for checking message delivery

props.name: system
props.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

props.name: embeds
props.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

props.name: attachments
props.description: A collection of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures - mapped by their ID.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was sent at

props.name: editedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: mentions
props.description: An object containing a further users, roles or channels collections

props.name: mentions.users
props.description: Mentioned users, maps their ID to the user object.

props.name: mentions.roles
props.description: Mentioned roles, maps their ID to the role object.

props.name: mentions.channels
props.description: Mentioned channels,maps their ID to the channel object.

props.name: mentions.everyone
props.description: Whether or not @everyone was mentioned.

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the message was sent

props.name: editedAt
props.description: The time the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the message was sent in (if in a guild channel)

props.name: cleanContent
props.description: The message contents with all mentions replaced by the equivalent text. If mentions cannot be resolved to a name,the relevant mention in the message content will not be converted.

props.name: edits
props.description: An array of cached versions of the message, including the current version.Sorted from latest (first) to oldest (last).

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the message is editable by the client user.

props.name: deletable
props.description: Whether the message is deletable by the client user.

props.name: pinnable
props.description: Whether the message is pinnable by the client user.

methods.name: isMentioned
methods.description: Whether or not a user, channel or role is mentioned in this message.

params.name: data
params.description: either a guild channel, user or a role object, or a string representingthe ID of any of these.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit the content of the message
examples: // update the content of a messagemessage.edit('This is my new content!') .then(msg => console.log(`Updated the content of a message from ${msg.author}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: editCode
methods.description: Edit the content of the message, with a code block

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message
examples: // delete a messagemessage.delete() .then(msg => console.log(`Deleted message from ${msg.author}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long to wait to delete the message in milliseconds

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Reply to the message
examples: // reply to a messagemessage.reply('Hey, I'm a reply!') .then(msg => console.log(`Sent a reply to ${msg.author}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messageswithout checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. Thismethod allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Message's content instead of the object.
examples: // logs: Message: This is a message!console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

classes.name: MessageAttachment
classes.description: Represents an Attachment in a Message

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that instantiated this Message.

props.name: message
props.description: The message this attachment is part of.

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of this attachment

props.name: filename
props.description: The file name of this attachment

props.name: filesize
props.description: The size of this attachment in bytes

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to this attachment

props.name: proxyURL
props.description: The Proxy URL to this attachment

props.name: height
props.description: The height of this attachment (if an image)

props.name: width
props.description: The width of this attachment (if an image)

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description: Collects messages based on a specified filter, then emits them.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to collect messages in

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel this collector is operating on

props.name: filter
props.description: A function used to filter messages that the collector collects.

props.name: options
props.description: Options for the collecor.

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has stopped collecting Messages.

props.name: collected
props.description: A collection of collected messages, mapped by message ID.

props.name: next
props.description: Returns a promise that resolves when a valid message is sent. Rejectswith collected messages if the Collector ends before receiving a message.

methods.description: Verifies a message against the filter and options

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the collector and emits `end`.

params.description: An optional reason for stopping the collector

events.name: message

methods.name: serialize
methods.description: Get an object mapping permission names to whether or not the role enables that permission
examples: // print the serialized roleconsole.log(role.serialize());

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks if the role has a permission.
examples: // see if a role can ban a memberif (role.hasPermission('BAN_MEMBERS')) {  console.log('This role can ban members');} else {  console.log('This role can\'t ban members');}

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the role to explicitly have the exact permission

methods.name: hasPermissions
methods.description: Checks if the role has all specified permissions.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the role to explicitly have the exact permissions

methods.name: comparePositionTo
methods.description: Compares this role's position to another role's.

params.name: role
params.description: Role to compare to this one

returns.description: Negative number if the this role's position is lower (other role's is higher),positive number if the this one is higher (other's is lower), 0 if equal

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the role
examples: // edit a rolerole.edit({name: 'new role'}) .then(r => console.log(`Edited role ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The new data for the role

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the role
examples: // set the name of the rolerole.setName('new role') .then(r => console.log(`Edited name of role ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the role

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Set a new color for the role
examples: // set the color of a rolerole.setColor('#FF0000') .then(r => console.log(`Set color of role ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: color
params.description: The new color for the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

methods.name: setHoist
methods.description: Set whether or not the role should be hoisted
examples: // set the hoist of the rolerole.setHoist(true) .then(r => console.log(`Role hoisted: ${r.hoist}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: hoist
params.description: Whether or not to hoist the role

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set the position of the role
examples: // set the position of the rolerole.setPosition(1) .then(r => console.log(`Role position: ${r.position}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setPermissions
methods.description: Set the permissions of the role
examples: // set the permissions of the rolerole.setPermissions(['KICK_MEMBERS', 'BAN_MEMBERS']) .then(r => console.log(`Role updated ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setMentionable
methods.description: Set whether this role is mentionable
examples: // make the role mentionablerole.setMentionable(true) .then(r => console.log(`Role updated ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: mentionable
params.description: Whether this role should be mentionable

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the role
examples: // delete a rolerole.delete() .then(r => console.log(`Deleted role ${r}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this role equals another role. It compares all properties, so for most operationsit is advisable to just compare `role.id === role2.id` as it is much faster and is oftenwhat most users need.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Role mention rather than the Role object.

methods.name: comparePositions
methods.description: Compares the positions of two roles.

returns.description: Negative number if the first role's position is lower (second role's is higher),positive number if the first's is higher (second's is lower), 0 if equal

methods.description: Gets a single message from this channel, regardless of it being cached or not.<warn>Only OAuth bot accounts can use this method.</warn>
examples: // get messagechannel.fetchMessage('99539446449315840')  .then(message => console.log(message.content))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: messageID
params.description: The ID of the message to get

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples: // stop typing in a channelchannel.stopTyping();
// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete given messages.Only OAuth Bot accounts may use this method.

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages to delete, or number of messages to delete

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.
examples: // overwrite permissions for a message authormessage.channel.overwritePermissions(message.author, { SEND_MESSAGES: false}).then(() => console.log('Done!')).catch(console.error);
