classes.name: Collection
classes.description: A utility class to help make it easier to access the data stores

methods.name: array
methods.description: Creates an ordered array of the values of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only bereconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you add/remove elements on the array.
examples: // identical to:Array.from(collection.values());

methods.name: keyArray
methods.description: Creates an ordered array of the keys of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only bereconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you add/remove elements on the array.
examples: // identical to:Array.from(collection.keys());

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first item in this collection.

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Returns the first key in this collection.

methods.name: last
methods.description: Returns the last item in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the values must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description: Returns the last key in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the keys must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Returns a random item from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the values must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description: Returns a random key from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the keys must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: findAll
methods.description: Returns an array of items where `item[prop] === value` of the collection
examples: collection.findAll('username', 'Bob');

methods.name: find
methods.description: Returns a single item where `item[prop] === value`, or the given function returns `true`.In the latter case, this is identical to[Array.find()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find).
examples: collection.find('username', 'Bob');
collection.find(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: findKey
methods.description: Returns the key of the item where `item[prop] === value`, or the given function returns `true`.In the latter case, this is identical to[Array.findIndex()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/findIndex).
examples: collection.findKey('username', 'Bob');
collection.findKey(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Returns true if the collection has an item where `item[prop] === value`
examples: if (collection.exists('username', 'Bob')) { console.log('user here!');}

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Identical to[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: filterArray
methods.description: Identical to[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: map
methods.description: Identical to[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: some
methods.description: Identical to[Array.some()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/some).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: every
methods.description: Identical to[Array.every()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/every).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: reduce
methods.description: Identical to[Array.reduce()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/reduce).

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.
examples: const newColl = someColl.concat(someOtherColl, anotherColl, ohBoyAColl);

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description: If the items in this collection have a delete method (e.g. messages), invokethe delete method. Returns an array of promises

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features

props.name: messages
props.description: A Collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

props.name: lastMessageID
props.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

props.name: typingCount
props.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel
examples: // send a messagechannel.sendMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel
examples: // send a TTS messagechannel.sendTTSMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent tts message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

params.name: content
params.description: Text message to send with the attachment

methods.name: sendCode
methods.description: Send a code block to this channel

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a single message from this channel, regardless of it being cached or not.<warn>Only OAuth bot accounts can use this method.</warn>
examples: // get messagechannel.fetchMessage('99539446449315840')  .then(message => console.log(message.content))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: messageID
params.description: The ID of the message to get

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples: // stop typing in a channelchannel.stopTyping();
// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete given messages.Only OAuth Bot accounts may use this method.

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages to delete, or number of messages to delete

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:* A User object* A User ID* A Message (resolves to the message author)* A Guild (owner of the guild)* A Guild Member

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:* A Guild object

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:* A GuildMember object* A User object

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:* An instance of a Channel* An instance of a Message (the channel the message was sent in)* An instance of a Guild (the #general channel)* An ID of a Channel

typedefs.name: InviteResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give an invite code. This can be:* An invite code* An invite URL

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:* A string* A permission numberPossible strings:```js[  "CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE",  "KICK_MEMBERS",  "BAN_MEMBERS",  "ADMINISTRATOR",  "MANAGE_CHANNELS",  "MANAGE_GUILD",  "READ_MESSAGES",  "SEND_MESSAGES",  "SEND_TTS_MESSAGES",  "MANAGE_MESSAGES",  "EMBED_LINKS",  "ATTACH_FILES",  "READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY",  "MENTION_EVERYONE",  "EXTERNAL_EMOJIS", // use external emojis  "CONNECT", // connect to voice  "SPEAK", // speak on voice  "MUTE_MEMBERS", // globally mute members on voice  "DEAFEN_MEMBERS", // globally deafen members on voice  "MOVE_MEMBERS", // move member's voice channels  "USE_VAD", // use voice activity detection  "CHANGE_NICKNAME",  "MANAGE_NICKNAMES", // change nicknames of others  "MANAGE_ROLES_OR_PERMISSIONS"]```

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:* A string* An Array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)* Any value

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:* A Buffer* A Base64 string

typedefs.name: FileResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:* A Buffer* The path to a local file* A URL

typedefs.name: StreamOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed to stream-playing methods:

props.name: seek
props.description: The time to seek to

props.name: volume
props.description: The volume to play at

props.name: passes
props.description: How many times to send the voice packet to reduce packet loss

typedefs.name: PermissionOverwriteOptions
typedefs.description: An object mapping permission flags to `true` (enabled) or `false` (disabled)```js{ 'SEND_MESSAGES': true, 'ATTACH_FILES': false,}```

typedefs.name: InviteOptions
typedefs.description: Options given when creating a Guild Channel Invite

props.name: temporary
props.description: Whether the invite should kick users after 24hrs if they are not given a role

props.name: maxAge
props.description: Time in seconds the invite expires in

props.name: maxUses
props.description: Maximum amount of uses for this invite

typedefs.name: MessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into sendMessage, sendTTSMessage, sendFile, sendCode, or Message.reply

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message should be spoken aloud

props.name: nonce
props.description: The nonce for the message

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description: Whether or not @everyone and @hereshould be replaced with plain-text

props.name: split
props.description: Whether or not the message should be split into multiple messages ifit exceeds the character limit. If an object is provided, these are the options for splitting the message.

typedefs.name: SplitOptions
typedefs.description: Options for splitting a message

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum character length per message piece

props.name: char
props.description: Character to split the message with

props.name: prepend
props.description: Text to prepend to every piece except the first

props.name: append
props.description: Text to append to every piece except the last

typedefs.name: ChannelLogsQueryOptions
typedefs.description: The parameters to pass in when requesting previous messages from a channel. `around`, `before` and`after` are mutually exclusive. All the parameters are optional.

props.name: limit
props.description: Number of messages to acquire

props.name: before
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted before it

props.name: after
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted after it

props.name: around
props.description: ID of a message to get the messages that were posted around it

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing the same properties as CollectorOptions, but a few more:

props.name: errors
props.description: Stop/end reasons that cause the promise to reject

typedefs.name: CollectorFilterFunction
typedefs.description: A function that takes a Message object and a MessageCollector and returns a boolean.```jsfunction(message, collector) { if (message.content.includes('discord')) {   return true; // passed the filter test } return false; // failed the filter test}```

typedefs.name: CollectorOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing options used to configure a MessageCollector. All properties are optional.

props.name: time
props.description: Duration for the collector in milliseconds

props.name: max
props.description: Maximum number of messages to handle

props.name: maxMatches
props.description: Maximum number of successfully filtered messages to obtain

typedefs.name: WebhookMessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into sendMessage, sendTTSMessage, sendFile, sendCode

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message should be spoken aloud

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description: Whether or not @everyone and @hereshould be replaced with plain-text

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options for a Client.

props.name: apiRequestMethod
props.description: 'sequential' or 'burst'. Sequential executes all requests inthe order they are triggered, whereas burst runs multiple at a time, and doesn't guarantee a particular order.

props.name: shardId
props.description: The ID of this shard

props.name: shardCount
props.description: The number of shards

props.name: messageCacheMaxSize
props.description: Maximum number of messages to cache per channel

props.name: sync
props.description: Whether to periodically sync guilds(-1 for unlimited - don't do this without message sweeping, otherwise memory usage will climb indefinitely)

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description: How long until a message should be uncached by the message sweeping(in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description: How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older thanthe message cache lifetime (in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: fetchAllMembers
props.description: Whether to cache all guild members and users upon startup, as well asupon joining a guild

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description: Default value for MessageOptions.disableEveryone

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description: Maximum time permitted between REST responses and theircorresponding websocket events

props.name: disabledEvents
props.description: An array of disabled websocket events. Events in this array will not beprocessed. Disabling useless events such as 'TYPING_START' can result in significant performance increases onlarge-scale bots.

props.name: ws
props.description: Options for the websocket

typedefs.name: WebsocketOptions
typedefs.description: Websocket options. These are left as snake_case to match the API.

props.name: large_threshold
props.description: Number of members in a guild to be considered large

props.name: compress
props.description: Whether to compress data sent on the connection
